Key Match Events: Jusuf Nurkic made the second of two free throws with 0.8 seconds left after getting fouled on an offensive rebound, lifting the Phoenix Suns to a 114-113 victory over the Dallas Mavericks.
Daniel Gafford got Dallas even at 113 on an alley-oop dunk from Luka Doncic, who had 30 points, seven assists and seven rebounds.
Royce O’Neale missed a runner in the lane in the final seconds, but Nurkic grabbed the rebound and was bumped by several Dallas defenders on a missed shot as the buzzer sounded.
Doncic was short on a desperation 3-pointer at the buzzer.
Post-Match Reflections: The Phoenix Suns improved to 8-1 for the first time since 2009-10.
The Suns improved to 2-0 against the defending Western Conference champion Dallas.
Gafford fouled out on the play.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kevin Durant scored 26 points, and Nurkic had 15 points and 10 rebounds as the Suns improved to 8-1.
O’Neale scored 18 points for Phoenix, and Devin Booker had 13 points and 12 assists.
Kyrie Irving scored 29 points, and Naji Marshall had 18 for Dallas.
Phoenix reserves outscoring the Dallas bench 28-9 after a 23-9 edge in the first meeting.
Dwight Powell was forced to play a season-high 25 minutes and had five fouls.
Others: The Suns are home against Sacramento on Sunday.
The Mavericks are at Denver on Sunday night.
